required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tislelizumab in Combination With Chemotherapy as First-Line Treatment in Adults With Inoperable, Locally Advanced or Metastatic Gastric, or Gastroesophageal Junction Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 3 Clinical Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Tislelizumab (BGB-A317) Plus Platinum and Fluoropyrimidine Versus Placebo Plus Platinum and Fluoropyrimidine as First-Line Treatment in Patients With Locally Advanced Unresectable or Metastatic Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized (1:1), double-blind, placebo-controlled, Phase 3 study designed to compare the efficacy and safety of tislelizumab or placebo plus chemotherapy as first-line (1L) therapy for locally advanced unresectable or metastatic gastric or gastroesophageal junction (GEJ) adenocarcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: The time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.description: The time from the date of randomization to the date of the first objectively documented tumor progression
The proportion of participants whose best overall response is complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle through cycle 6 (each cycle is 21 days), and then every other cycle for up to 48 months
secondary_outcome.description: The time from the first determination of an objective response per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1, until the first documentation of progression or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Gastric Cancer Module QLQ-STO22 (EORTC QLQ-STO22)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle through cycle 6 (each cycle is 21 days), and then every other cycle for up to 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 Score (EORTC QLQ-30)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle through cycle 6 (each cycle is 21 days), and then every other cycle for up to 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in European Quality of Life 5-Dimensions 5-Levels Health Questionnaire Score (EQ-5D-5L)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, at every cycle through cycle 6 (each cycle is 21 days), and then every other cycle for up to 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing Adverse Events (AEs)
Number of participants experiencing Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of complete response + partial response + stable disease
Proportion of complete response + partial response + durable stable disease
Time from randomization to the first determination of an objective response

arm_group.description: Tislelizumab and chemotherapy. Oxaliplatin + capecitabine or cisplatin + 5-Fluorouracil regimens are used as the backbone chemotherapy.
Placebo and chemotherapy. Oxaliplatin + capecitabine or cisplatin + 5-FU regimens are used as the backbone chemotherapy.

intervention.description: 200 mg IV on Day 1 during each 21-day cycle
Placebo to match zanubrutinib on Day 1 during each 21-day cycle
80 mg/m² IV on Day 1 during each 21-day cycle
130 mg/m² IV on Day 1 during each 21-day cycle
1000 mg/m² orally twice daily (BD) Days 1 through 14 (14 days total) during each 21-day cycle
800 mg/m²/day IV using continuous pumping system on Days 1 through 5 during each 21-day cycle

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Locally advanced unresectable or metastatic GC or GEJ carcinoma and have histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma
2. No previous systemic therapy for locally advanced unresectable or metastatic gastric/GEJ cancer. NOTE: Participants may have received prior neoadjuvant or adjuvant therapy as long as it was completed and have no recurrence or disease progression for at least 6 months.
3. ECOG PS ≤ 1 within 7 days prior to randomization
4. Adequate organ function as indicated by the following laboratory values ≤ days prior to randomization
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has squamous cell or undifferentiated or other histological type GC
2. Active leptomeningeal disease or uncontrolled brain metastasis
3. Diagnosed with gastric or GEJ adenocarcinoma with positive HER2
4. Prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2 or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
